intro: Peucedanum chabraei var. selinoides, commonly known as the Selinoides angelica, is a variant of the angelica plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a biennial herb characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its roots are often harvested for their aromatic properties and traditional medicinal uses. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is valued for its potential health benefits.
